description: How the psychologists Daniel Kahneman and Amos Tversky upended assumptions about the decision-making process and invented the field of behavioral economics. Their close friendship and porous collaboration style became one of the greatest partnerships in the history of science.
title: THE UNDOING PROJECT
author: Michael Lewis

description: How to communicate love with quality time, affirmative words, gifts, acts of service, and physical touch. Originally published in 1992.
title: THE FIVE LOVE LANGUAGES
author: Gary Chapman

description: The author examines the roots of rejection and its ability to poison relationships, including one’s relationship with God.
title: UNINVITED
author: Lysa TerKeurst

description: How the courage to be vulnerable transforms the way we live, love, parent and lead. Originally published in 2012.
title: DARING GREATLY
author: Brené Brown

description: More personal essays from the comedian and actress, the creator and star of "The Mindy Project."
title: WHY NOT ME?
author: Mindy Kaling

description: After her husband confesses to multiple infidelities, a woman struggles to grow — and so does he.
title: LOVE WARRIOR
author: Glennon Doyle Melton

description: The comedian enlists a sociologist to help him understand today’s dating scene.
title: MODERN ROMANCE
author: Aziz Ansari with Eric Klinenberg

description: A collection of essays on race, gender, politics and "Sweet Valley High."
title: BAD FEMINIST
author: Roxane Gay

description: How modern society’s loss of the sense of belonging — now achieved mostly in the military and in disasters — has led to income inequality, incivility and mental disorders like PTSD.
title: TRIBE
author: Sebastian Junger
